==Events==
* [[694]] &ndash; At the [[Seventeenth Council of Toledo]], [[Egica]], a king of the [[Visigoths]] of [[Hispania]], accuses [[Jew]]s of aiding [[Muslim]]s, sentencing all Jews to [[slavery]].
*[[1282]] &ndash; [[Pope Martin IV]] excommunicates King [[Peter III of Aragon]].
*[[1313]] &ndash; [[Louis the Bavarian]] defeats his cousin [[Frederick I of Austria (Habsburg)|Frederick I of Austria]] at the [[Battle of Gamelsdorf]].
*[[1330]] &ndash; At the [[Battle of Posada]], the [[Vlachs|Wallachian]] [[Voivode]] [[Basarab I]] defeats the [[Hungary|Hungarian]] army of [[Charles I of Hungary|Charles I Robert]].
*[[1456]] &ndash; [[Ulrich II of Celje]] ([[Slovene language|Slovene]]: Ulrik Celjski, [[German language|German]] Ulrich von Cilli, [[Hungarian language|Hungarian]]: Cillei Ulrik), last [[prince]] of [[Celje]] [[principality]], is assassinated in [[Belgrade]].
*[[1494]] &ndash; The [[Family de' Medici]] are expelled from [[Florence]].
*[[1520]] &ndash; More than 50 people are sentenced and executed in the [[Stockholm Bloodbath]]
*[[1620]] &ndash; [[Pilgrim (Plymouth Colony)|Pilgrim]]s aboard the ''[[Mayflower]]'' sight land at [[Cape Cod]], [[Massachusetts]].
*[[1688]] &ndash; [[Glorious Revolution]]: [[William III of England|William of Orange]] captures [[Exeter]].
*[[1697]] &ndash; [[Pope Innocent XII]] founds the city of [[Cervia]].
*[[1720]] &ndash; The synagogue of [[Judah he-Hasid (Jerusalem)|Yehudah he-Hasid]] is burned down by Arab creditors, leading to the expulsion of the [[Ashkenazi Jews|Ashkenazim]] from [[Jerusalem]].
*[[1729]] &ndash; [[Spain]], [[France]] and [[Great Britain]] sign the [[Treaty of Seville]].
*[[1764]] &ndash; [[Mary Campbell (colonial settler)|Mary Campbell]], a captive of the [[Lenape]] during the [[French and Indian War]], is turned over to forces commanded by Colonel [[Henry Bouquet]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: In the [[Battle of Fishdam Ford]] a force of British and Loyalist troops fail in a surprise attack against the [[South Carolina]] Patriot militia under Brigadier General [[Thomas Sumter]].
*[[1791]] &ndash; Foundation of the Dublin [[Society of United Irishmen]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[William Carey (missionary)|William Carey]] reaches the [[Hooghly River]].
*[[1799]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon Bonaparte]] leads the [[coup d'état]] of [[18 Brumaire]] ending the [[French Directory|Directory]] government, and becoming one of its three Consuls ([[French Consulate|Consulate Government]]).
*[[1822]] &ndash; The [[Action of 9 November 1822]] between {{USS|Alligator|1820|6}} and a squadron of [[pirate]] [[schooner]]s off the coast of [[Cuba]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Robert Blum]], a [[Germany|German]] revolutionary, is executed in [[Vienna]].
*[[1851]] &ndash; [[Kentucky]] marshals abduct abolitionist minister [[Calvin Fairbank]] from [[Jeffersonville, Indiana]], and take him to Kentucky to stand trial for helping a slave escape.
*[[1857]] &ndash; ''[[The Atlantic]]'' is founded in [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; The first documented [[Canadian Football|football]] match in [[Canada]] is played at [[University College, University of Toronto]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[United States|Union]] General [[Ambrose Burnside]] assumes command of the [[Army of the Potomac]], after [[George B. McClellan]] is removed.
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[Tokugawa Shogunate]] hands power back to the [[Emperor of Japan]], starting the [[Meiji Restoration]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; The [[Great Boston Fire of 1872]].
*[[1880]] &ndash; A large earthquake strikes [[Zagreb]] and causes many casualties. One of them is the [[Zagreb Cathedral]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; The [[Royal Winnipeg Rifles]] of the [[Canadian Forces]] (known then as the "90th Winnipeg Battalion of Rifles") is founded.
*[[1887]] &ndash; The [[United States]] receives rights to [[Pearl Harbor, Hawaii]].
*[[1888]] &ndash; [[Mary Jane Kelly]] is murdered in London, widely believed to be the fifth and final victim of the notorious unidentified serial killer [[Jack the Ripper]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Theodore Roosevelt]] is the first sitting [[President of the United States]] to make an official trip outside the country. He did so to inspect progress on the [[Panama Canal]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; The [[Cullinan Diamond]] is presented to [[Edward VII of the United Kingdom|King Edward VII]] on his birthday.
*[[1913]] &ndash; The [[Great Lakes Storm of 1913]], the most destructive natural disaster ever to hit the lakes, destroys 19 ships and kills more than 250 people.
*[[1914]] &ndash; {{Ship|SMS|Emden|1908|6}} is sunk by {{HMAS|Sydney|1912|6}} in the [[Battle of Cocos]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[Joseph Stalin]] enters the provisional government of Bolshevik Russia.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Kaiser]] [[Wilhelm II, German Emperor|Wilhelm II of Germany]] abdicates after the [[German Revolution of 1918–1919|German Revolution]], and [[Germany]] is proclaimed a Republic.
*[[1921]] &ndash; The [[Partito Nazionale Fascista]] (PNF), National Fascist Party, comes into existence.
*[[1923]] &ndash; In [[Munich, Germany]], police and government troops crush the [[Beer Hall Putsch]] in [[Bavaria]]. The failed coup is the work of the [[Nazis]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[Congress of Industrial Organizations]] is founded in [[Atlantic City, New Jersey]], by eight [[trade unions]] belonging to the [[American Federation of Labor]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Japan]]ese troops take control of [[Shanghai]], [[Republic of China (1912–49)|China]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; The Nazi German diplomat [[Ernst vom Rath]] dies from the fatal gunshot wounds of Jewish resistance fighter [[Herschel Grynszpan]], an act which the Nazis used as an excuse to instigate the 1938 national [[pogrom]], also known as [[Kristallnacht]] (Crystal Night).
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Warsaw]] is awarded the [[Virtuti Militari]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Cambodia]] gains independence from [[France]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Robert McNamara]] is named president of [[Ford Motor Co.]], the first non-Ford to serve in that post. A month later, he resigned to join the administration of newly elected [[John F. Kennedy]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; At [[Miike coal mine]], [[Miike District, Fukuoka|Miike]], [[Japan]], an explosion kills 458, and hospitalises 839 with [[carbon monoxide poisoning]]. 
*[[1965]] &ndash; Several [[U.S. state]]s and parts of [[Canada]] are hit by a series of [[Power outage|blackout]]s lasting up to 13 hours in the [[Northeast Blackout of 1965]].
*  1965   &ndash; The [[Catholic Worker Movement]] member [[Roger Allen LaPorte]], protesting against the [[Vietnam War]], [[Self-immolation|sets himself on fire]] in front of the [[United Nations]] building.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: [[NASA]] launches the unmanned [[Apollo 4]] test spacecraft atop the first [[Saturn V]] rocket from [[Cape Kennedy, Florida]].
*  1967   &ndash; The first issue of [[Rolling Stone]] Magazine is published.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] votes 6 to 3 against hearing a case to allow [[Massachusetts]] to enforce its law granting residents the right to refuse military service in an undeclared war.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[North American Aerospace Defense Command#False alarms|Nuclear false alarm]]: the [[NORAD]] computers and the Alternate National Military Command Center in [[Fort Ritchie, Maryland]] detected purported massive [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] nuclear strike. After reviewing the raw data from satellites and checking the [[early warning]] radars, the alert is cancelled.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Garry Kasparov]], 22, of the [[Soviet Union]] becomes the youngest [[World Chess Champion]] by beating [[Anatoly Karpov]], also of the Soviet Union.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: [[Berlin Wall|Fall of the Berlin Wall]]. [[Communism|Communist]]-controlled [[East Germany]] opens [[Border checkpoint|checkpoint]]s in the Berlin Wall allowing its citizens to travel to [[West Germany]]. This key event led to the eventual [[German reunification|reunification of East and West Germany]], and [[fall of communism]] in eastern Europe including Russia.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Stari most]], the "old bridge" in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]]n [[Mostar]] built in [[1566]], collapses after several days of bombing.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[chemical element]] [[Darmstadtium]] is discovered.
*[[1998]] &ndash; A US federal judge orders 37 US brokerage houses to pay 1.03 billion [[United States dollar|USD]] to cheated [[NASDAQ]] investors to compensate for [[price-fixing]]. This is the largest civil settlement in [[United States]] history.
*  1998   &ndash; [[Capital punishment in the United Kingdom]], already abolished for [[murder]], is completely abolished for all remaining capital offences.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Venus Express]] mission of the [[European Space Agency]] is launched from the [[Baikonur Cosmodrome]] in [[Kazakhstan]].
*  2005   &ndash; [[2005 Amman bombings|Suicide bombers attacked]] three hotels in [[Amman, Jordan]], killing at least 60 people.
*[[2007]] &ndash; The German [[Bundestag]] passes the controversial [[Telecommunications data retention|data retention bill]] mandating storage of citizens' telecommunications traffic data for six months without [[probable cause]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; A train carrying liquid fuel [[2012 Burma train crash|crashes and bursts into flames]] in northern [[Burma]], killing 27 people and injuring 80 others.
